features: Self-heating to warm and relax tired, achy feet
Deeply penetrates to the muscles of the foot
body.description: Dr. Scholl's® Tired, Achy Feet Soothing & Reviving Foot Mask is a pair of self-heating single-use booties that gently warm to help ingredients like Epsom salt and menthol to deeply penetrate to the muscles of the foot. Specially formulated to provide fast and lasting relief, these masks help your feet feel relaxed and relieve everyday achiness - like taking a soothing bath. They are also infused with shea butter, lavender and peppermint essential oils to leave your feet feeling soft, moisturized and renewed.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Unique Patent-Pending design with adjustable gel pad & night splint to conform to your exact foot size Clinically tested to provide substantial relief of bunion pain Clinically tested & shown to help correct toe positioning to further reduce pain Comfortable & effective bunion protection with Massaging Gel

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Essential for Disney world
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use, not messy, very soothing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great product..highly recommend, self care time is so important
reviews.reviewText: I got these for self care time.. Sit back, get a book or binge a show. The booties heat up and get your feet super soft. Enjoy your time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Used after climbing eiffel tower, relaxing and medicated.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great and they fit mens size 13
reviews.reviewText: I bought these tried one pair and immediately bought more. They fit me which is good since I wear size 13 shoes. They aren't exactly heating it's basically icy hot in a sock not quite what I was expecting but they do work well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A lot of work
reviews.reviewText: This is kind of a lot of messy weirdness and strange sensation. I was sort of overwhelmed by them and am dreading using them again. I might at some point but it's not realistic for regular use. Too messy and just a lot lol

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Convenient at home treatment
reviews.reviewText: I really like how easy to use and mess free these masks are. They're perfect to use after a long day...who has time to actually relax and do the self care they deserve? Not me. I wanted something I could just put on and forget about. These are perfect for that.As a bonus, the masks smell wonderful. I used them before bedtime to help moisturize my dry heels and feet. The masks do heat slowly, warming up gradually, before getting "hot." I did not find the sensation to be unbearable at all. The fist time I used them it was a little weird, but I really enjoyed the gradual buildup. I do agree with the other reviews that mentioned the quality of the tabs on the booties. They aren't the greatest at securing the bootie closed. I wore a pair of socks over them since I was just relaxing in bed. That helped secure everything much better. Obviously you wouldn't want to get up and walk around, but it worked well for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Definitely recommend if ur feet ache specially during travel trips

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars literally not in the least bit worth your effort
reviews.reviewText: i very rarely write one star reviews, especially ones where i'm ranting, but these are so horrible. i bought these to try out after my 10 hour black Friday shift because my feet always ache so bad after standing for so long. I was excited and hopeful that these would solve my problems. plus, its 23°F outside so I was excited about the idea of having something warm on my feet.at no point did these get warm. in fact, I'm certain that they got even colder. and then my feet began to sting, which the package said was normal, but became very uncomfortable. i couldn't even make it the full 30 minutes that the instructions recommend.taking them off was almost even worse. when I took them off, my feet were dripping with the slimy mask. i couldn't even wipe it all off and the smell of menthol was so strong. i should've known better, but I jumped into the shower to warm up and wash off the slime. that's where it got even worse. because of the menthol, my feet began to BURN. it became even more painful to stand and let the warm water hit my feet.so basically, after my 10 hour shift on my feet, I am left with even more pain in my feet than I had before. an absolutely horrible way to end my day and I don't recommend these to anyone. the ONLY benefit of these is that my feet are now very soft, but nothing I couldn't achieve from lotion.
